title.value: Продуктивные и воспроизводительные качества дебикированных ремонтных петухов
Productive and reproductive qualities of debeaked rearing roosters
Productive and reproductive qualities of debeaked rearing roosters

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Gorchakova, O.I., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: The major killing among rearing roosters because of pecking and cannibalism happens within the period of 20 up to 45-day's age to gradual reduction by 70 days of growing. During researches on rearing and adult roosters of line K4 of breed-cross 'Belarus Korichnevyj', and also on cocks of fatherly parental form АВ of breed-cross 'Khajseks belyj' it has been established, that debeaking of rearing roosters at 7-day's age is more preferable in comparison with operating young growth in 42 or 70 days as allows avoiding pecking display during the early period of growing and does not render negative influence on productive and reproductive parameters. At bird' artificial fertilization the eggs insemination makes 94,7-96,7 %, its hatchability - of 83,4-86,6 %, a breeding of young growth - 80,7-82,0 %. In conditions of natural reproduction according to parameters - 96,1-97,8 %, 84,1-85,5 % and 80,8-83,0 %. The best parameters of safety and reproductive qualities of cocks-manufacturers are reached at their maintenance in communities with debeaked hens.
